webLinks.linkText: Mother's Day Classic fun run & walk 2022

properties.headline: Mother's Day Classic fun run - SYDNEY CBD Macquarie St, Prince Albert Rd, College St, Art Gallery Rd to The Domain
properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.

arrangementAttachments.displayName: Mother's Day Classic - Road closures & Clearways map 2022
arrangementAttachments.linkName: Mother's Day Classic - Road closures & Clearways map 2022

properties.otherAdvice:
Thousands of participants will take part in 7.5km and 4.8km Mother’s Day Classic fun run and walk events starting from 7:30am in The Domain. Participants will travel along sections of Macquarie St, College St then Art Gallery Rd and Mrs Macquarie's Rd to finish back in The Domain by approximately 12pm.

ROAD CLOSURES

  • 5am to 12pm - Art Gallery Rd/ Mrs Macquarie's Rd from Prince Albert Rd and Hospital Rd. Access to Hospital Rd is via Shakespeare Place only in both directions.
  • 6am to 10am - Macquarie St between St James Rd and Hunter St, College St between Park St and Prince Albert Rd and sections of St James Rd, Prince Albert Rd and Yurong Pkway will be closed.

Special event clearways will be in effect from 5am to 10am on sections of Macquarie St, Hunter St, College St, St Marys Rd, Prince Albert Rd and St James Rd. Clearways will also be in effect on sections of Prince Albert Rd and Hospital Rd from 5am to 12pm midday.

Clearways are strict no-parking zones even for local residents and Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies.

Mother’s Day is traditionally one of the busiest days on the roads. Wherever you are travelling, expect it to take longer than usual and factor in extra travel time.

arrangementElements.html:
Special event clearways are strict no-parking zones even for local residents and Mobility Scheme Parking Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your vehicle is towed, call 132 701 to find its new location.

Clearways are in effect on both sides unless specified otherwise.

SYDNEY CBD

FROM 5AM TO 10AM

  • College Street between Park Street and Prince Albert Road        
  • Hunter Street between Macquarie Street and Elizabeth Street 
  • Macquarie Street between St James Road and Bent Street         
  • St James Road between Elizabeth Street and Prince Albert Road              
  • Prince Albert Road between St James Road and St Mary's Rd          
  • St Mary’s Road between Prince Albert Road and Sir John Young Cres

FROM 5AM TO 12PM MIDDAY

  • Hospital Road between Prince Albert Road and Sydney Hospital Pedestrian Crossing      
  • Prince Albert Road between St Mary’s Road and Hospital Road
arrangementElements.title: Special Event Clearways

arrangementElements.html:
SYDNEY CBD

FROM 5AM TO 12PM MIDDAY

  • Art Gallery Rd from Prince Albert Road
  • Hospital Road* between Prince Albert Road and Shakespeare Place
  • Prince Albert Road between St Mary’s Road and Hospital Road 

Notes:

* Access to Hospital Road will be via Shakespeare Place only, in both directions. Vehicle access is limited to vehicles requiring access to Sydney Hospital, emergency services, contracted tow trucks and accredited / authorised event vehicles.

NB: Hospital Rd will be heavily used by pedestrians during the event, crossing in both directions between The Domain and the Start Line.

FROM 6AM TO 10AM

  • Boomerang Place/ Yurong Parkway between William Street and St Mary’s Road (northbound)
  • College Street between Park Street and Prince Albert Road        
  • Macquarie Street between St James Road and Hunter Street
  • Prince Albert Road between St James Road and St Mary’s Road                
  • St James Road between Elizabeth Street and Prince Albert Road              
  • St Mary’s Road between Prince Albert Road and Cathedral Street
arrangementElements.title: Road Closures

roads.mainStreet: Macquarie St, Prince Albert Rd, College St, Art Gallery Rd

properties.headline: NRL - GOSFORD Dane Drive between Central Coast Highway AND Donnison Street
properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
NRL: Rabbitohs v Sea Eagles at Central Coast Stadium. Kick-off from 7:55pm and full-time approx. 9:55pm. 

Traffic may be heavier than usual on roads approaching the stadium including Central Coast Hwy, Pacific Hwy, Brisbane Water Dr, Donnison St and Mann St as fans travel to and from the game.

Dane Dr will be closed before the game between the Central Coast Hwy and Donnison St and will reopen after the game.

Motorists should allow extra travel time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on roads in the area.

properties.headline: A-League - GOSFORD Dane Drive between Central Coast Highway AND Donnison Street
properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
A-League Men: Central Coast Mariners v Western United. Kick-off from 4:05pm and full-time approx. 6:05pm. 

Traffic may be heavier than usual on roads approaching the stadium including Central Coast Hwy, Pacific Hwy, Brisbane Water Dr, Donnison St and Mann St as fans travel to and from the game.

Dane Dr will be closed from 2pm between the Central Coast Hwy and Donnison St and will reopen after the game.

Motorists should allow extra travel time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on roads in the area.

properties.headline: AFL - MOORE PARK Moore Park Road, Anzac Parade, Lang Road, Eastern Distributor approaching The Sydney Cricket Ground
properties.publicTransport: Match tickets include return travel on public transport. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.

arrangementAttachments.fileName: 2021 Moore Park transport and walking map mar21  SHUTTLES EP23.pdf

arrangementAttachments.displayName: Moore Park special event clearways map
arrangementAttachments.fileName: GS_2205_MOORE PARK EVENT DAY CLEARWAYS MAP_V004_22FEB22.pdf
arrangementAttachments.linkName: Moore Park special event clearways map

properties.otherAdvice:
AFL: Sydney Swans v Brisbane Lions at the SCG. First bounce from 4:40pm, full-time around 7:20pm. 

Traffic is expected to be heavier than usual on the Eastern Distributor, Moore Park Rd, Cleveland St, Anzac Pde and Lang Rd approaching Moore Park as fans travel to and from the match. 

Driver Ave will be partially closed outside the stadium from 11.45am and will remain closed until crowds have safely cleared the precinct.

Access EP2 Kippax grass car park via Moore Park Rd or EP3 grass car park and Entertainment Quarter car park via Lang Rd. If you're travelling in the Eastern Distributor use the Bondi exit for EP2 and the Randwick exit for EP3.

Special event clearways will be in effect on roads in and around Moore Park from 1pm until 9pm including sections of Lang Rd, Moore Park Rd, Albion St, Cleveland St, Chalmers St, Fitzroy St, Flinders St and Foveaux St.

Clearways are strict no-parking zones, even for local residents and Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies.

arrangementElements.html:
Special event clearways are strict no-parking zones even for local residents and Mobility Scheme Parking Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your vehicle is towed, call 132 701 to find its new location.

SURRY HILLS / MOORE PARK FROM 1PM TO 9PM

  • Albion Street between Mary Street and Flinders Street (northern side)
  • Albion Street between Bourke Street and Flinders Street (southern side)
  • Chalmers Street between Cleveland Street and Randle Street (western side)
  • Cleveland Street between South Dowling Street and City Road (both sides)
  • Flinders Street between Albion Street and Moore Park Road (eastern side)
  • Fitzroy Street between South Dowling Street and Bourke Street (northern side)
  • Foveaux Street between Bourke Street and Crown Street (northern side)
  • Lang Road between Cook Road and Anzac Parade (both sides)
  • Moore Park Road* between Driver Avenue and Anzac Parade (southern side)
  • Moore Park Road between Flinders Street and Greens Road (northern side)

*24 hour clearways are in effect on the southern side of Moore Park Road from Lang Road to Driver Avenue to support the pop-up cycleway.
arrangementElements.title: Special Event Clearways

Fans are urged to pre-book their parking online, available until 11:59pm the night before the event.

Clearways are strict no-parking zones even for local residents and Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies.

properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.

Traffic may be heavier than usual on Pittwater Rd, Old Pittwater Rd, Warringah Rd and Beacon Hill Rd as fans travel to and from the stadium.

Fans driving to the game should allow extra travel time as parking will be in high demand and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads.

properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
A-League Men: Sydney FC v Melbourne Victory at Netstrata Jubilee Stadium. Kick-off from 7:45pm and full-time approx. 9:45pm.

Traffic may be heavier than usual in both directions on the Princes Hwy approaching Kogarah as fans travel to and from the stadium.

Local roads around the stadium will close ahead of kick-off including Jubilee Avenue, Park Street and English Street. Roads will re-open once crowds have cleared the area.

Fans driving to the game should allow extra time for parking and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads.

properties.publicTransport: Match tickets include return travel on trains. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.

Traffic on roads approaching the stadium may be heavier than usual including Captain Cook Dr, Woolooware Rd and Gannons Rd. 

Motorists in the area should allow extra travel time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity.

properties.headline: Special event - ROCKDALE Walz Street between Railway Street AND Parker Street
properties.publicTransport: Plan ahead at transportnsw.info.
properties.otherAdvice:
Ramadan at Bayside will be held on Walz Street in Rockdale on Saturday 30 April from 7pm until 11:30pm. 

To acommodate the event Walz St between Railway St and Parker St will be closed from 5pm Saturday until 1am Sunday, and sections of Hesten Lane and Parker St will be closed from 7pm Saturday until 12:30am Sunday. 

Special event clearways will be in place on both sides of Walz St between Railway St and Parker St from 4:30pm until 1am, and from 4:30pm until midnight on Parker St between Ferrier St and Walz St (eastern side) and Railway St between Walz St and 85 Railway St (western side). 

Clearways are strict no-parking zones and apply even to local residents, businesses or Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies.

Motorists should allow extra travel time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity in the area.

Traffic may be heavier than usual on Pembroke Rd, Rose Payten Dr and Leumeah Rd as fans travel to and from the stadium.

Motorists should allow additional travel time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads.

Traffic may be heavier than usual on Burelli St, Corrimal St, Stewart St and Crown St as fans travel to and from the game.

Sections of Harbour St at the Stadium will be closed for crowd safety. Roads will re-open once crowds have cleared the area. 

Fans driving to the game should allow extra time for parking.

properties.headline: Super Rugby - LEICHHARDT Mary Street at Glover Street
properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
Super Rugby: Waratahs v Crusaders at Leichhardt Oval. Kick off from 5:05pm, full time at 7:05pm approx. 

Traffic may be heavier than usual on Mary St, Glover St, Perry St, Lilyfield Rd and Balmain Rd as attendees travel to and from the event.

Mary St may be partially closed at the oval before the game to allow attendees to safely arrive and leave the venue after the game. Local detours via Chapel St will be in place. Motorists requiring to access other venues in the Park should use either Maliyawul St or Glover St.

Attendees driving to the game should allow extra travel time for parking and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads.

properties.headline: NRL & Concert - SYDNEY OLYMPIC PARK M4 Motorway, Homebush Bay Drive, Parramatta Road, Centenary Drive
properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
NRL: Bulldogs v Roosters at Accor Stadium. Kick-off from 5:30pm and full-time approx 7:15pm. 

Midnight Mafia concert at Sydney Showground, starts from 4pm and finish approx midnight. 

Allow extra travel time on roads approaching the precinct including the M4 Mwy, Homebush Bay Dr, Concord Rd, Lane Cove Rd, Parramatta Rd, Centenary Dr and Silverwater Rd.

Fans are encouraged to arrive early and pre-book parking online ahead of time (available until 11:59pm the night before the event).

roads.mainStreet: M4 Motorway, Homebush Bay Drive, Parramatta Road, Centenary Drive

properties.headline: Cycle Ride - SYDNEY TO CANBERRA Various roads
properties.otherAdvice:
Cyclists will be taking part in a cycle ride from Sydney to Canberra, starting at Art Gallery Rd in the Domain on Friday 29 April and travelling to the National Police Memorial in Canberra on Sunday 1 May.

Cyclists will share the road with motorists and will travel via Parramatta Rd, New Canterbury Rd, Newbridge Rd, Hume Hwy, Campbelltown Rd, Narrellan Rd, Hume Mwy, Old Hume Hwy, Bowral Rd, Moss Vale Rd, Illawarra Hwy, Hume Hwy, Sydney Rd, McDermott Dr, Clinton St and Federal Hwy. 

Motorists should be aware of the groups of cyclists as they share roads each day. Motorists are also reminded when overtaking cyclists to leave a 1.5m distance on roads with speed limits over 60km/h and a 1m distance on roads 60km/h or under.

properties.headline: Hawkesbury Show - CLARENDON Hawkesbury Valley Way, Blacktown Road, The Northern Road, Richmond Road approaching Hawkesbury Showground
properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip by public transport.
properties.otherAdvice:
The 2022 Hawkesbury Show will be held at Hawkesbury Showground in Clarendon from Friday to Sunday. The show runs from 9am to 11pm on Friday and Saturday and until 5pm on Sunday.

Motorists should allow extra travel time on roads including Hawkesbury Valley Way, Blacktown Rd, The Northern Rd, and Richmond Rd approaching the Precinct as families travel to the showground over the weekend.

Very heavy traffic is expected in Clarendon and surrounding suburbs approaching the showground. Attendees travelling to the show are advised to use public transport where possible.

roads.mainStreet: Hawkesbury Valley Way, Blacktown Road, The Northern Road, Richmond Road

NBL: Sydney Kings v Illawarra Hawks at Qudos Bank Arena from 3pm, finish around 5pm.

Allow extra travel time on roads approaching the precinct including the M4 Mwy, Homebush Bay Dr, Concord Rd, Lane Cove Rd, Parramatta Rd, Centenary Dr and Silverwater Rd.

Fans are encouraged to arrive early and pre-book parking online ahead of time (available until 11:59pm the night before the event).

roads.mainStreet: M4 Mwy, Homebush Bay Drive, Parramatta Road

properties.headline: Music and BBQ Festival - Friday 6 to Sunday 8 May - SYDNEY OLYMPIC PARK M4 Mwy, Homebush Bay Drive, Parramatta Road approaching Sydney Showground
properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
Meatstock Music and BBQ Festival at Sydney Showground from 5pm on Friday, 11am Saturday and 10am Sunday.

Motorists should allow extra travel time on roads approaching the precinct including the M4 Mwy, Homebush Bay Dr, Concord Rd, Lane Cove Rd and Epping Rd as festivalgoers travel to the event.

Traffic may be heavier than usual on roads approaching Sydney Olympic Park as festivalgoers travel to and from the event.

Pre-book parking at Sydney Olympic Park online to secure a space, available by 11.59pm the night before.

properties.headline: Anzac Day Dawn Service and March - ADELONG Snowy Mountains Highway between Quartz Street AND Campbell Street
properties.otherAdvice:
Tumut St (Snowy Mountains Hwy) from Quartz St to Campbell St will be closed from 6am to 2pm for Anzac Day commemorations.

Motorists can detour via Campbell st, Gilmore St, Neill St, Gundagai St, Havelock St and Lynch St. 

Motorists should allow extra travel time and follow the directions of traffic controllers on-site.
properties.displayName: Anzac Day Dawn Service and March

properties.headline: Anzac Day Dawn Service & March - COONAMBLE Castlereagh Highway between Aberfords Street AND Namoi Street
properties.otherAdvice:
Castlereagh Hwy will be closed from Aberfords St to Namoi St between 5:30am and 4pm for Anzac Day commemorations.

Motorists can detour around the closure via Warrena St, Aurther St and Aberfords St.

Motorists should allow extra travel time and follow the directions of traffic controllers on-site.

properties.headline: Sydney Family Show - MOORE PARK Moore Park Road, Anzac Parade, Lang Road, Eastern Distributor approaching The Entertainment Quarter
properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
The Sydney Family Show is taking place at The Entertainment Quarter from Saturday 9 to Monday 25 April from 10am to 5pm each day.

Traffic is expected to be heavier than usual on Anzac Pde, Eastern Distributor, Moore Park Rd, Cleveland St and Lang Rd approaching Moore Park as families travel to and from The Sydney Family Show each day.

The precinct will be particularly busy on Anzac Day while an NRL game is held at the neighbouring Sydney Cricket Ground so allow plenty of extra travel time as parking will fill quickly.

Special event clearways will be in effect on roads in and around Moore Park on game days during the show so check signs carefully before parking as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies. 

Motorists should allow extra travel time in the area and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads.

roads.mainStreet: Moore Park Road, Anzac Parade, Lang Road, Eastern Distributor

properties.headline: Anzac Day Races - RANDWICK Anzac Parade, Alison Road, High Street approaching Royal Randwick Racecourse
properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
Anzac Day at Royal Randwick Racecourse. First race from 12:35pm. 

Traffic may be heavier than usual on Anzac Pde, Doncaster Ave, High St, Alison Rd and Darley Rd as event goers travel to and from the races and to and from nearby Sydney Cricket Ground in Moore Park for the annual Anzac Day NRL match. 

Motorists should allow extra travel time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads.

roads.mainStreet: Anzac Parade, Alison Road, High Street

properties.headline: SPECIAL EVENT Anzac Day March - SPRINGWOOD Macquarie Road at Hawkesbury Road
properties.adviceB: Delay your journey; Plan your journey

properties.headline: SPECIAL EVENT Anzac Day March - GLENBROOK Great Western Highway between Ross Street AND Hare Street
Anzac Day March - OURIMBAH Pacific Highway between Yates Road AND Chittaway Road
properties.otherAdvice:
The Pacific Hwy will be closed between Yates Rd and Chittaway Rd from 1:30pm to 2.30pm for Anzac Day commemorations.

Motorists will be detoured via Chittaway Rd, Enterprise Dr and Wyong Rd.

Motorists should allow extra travel time and follow the directions of traffic controllers on-site.

webLinks.linkText: Anzac Day - TfNSW interactive road closure map

properties.headline: Anzac Day Dawn Service & March - SYDNEY CBD Martin Place, Elizabeth Street, Liverpool Street
properties.publicTransport: Travel on public transport is free on Anzac Day. Buses are diverting and using different stops while roads are closed. Visit transportnsw.info for details.

arrangementAttachments.displayName: Anzac Day 2022 road closures and clearways
arrangementAttachments.linkName: Anzac Day 2022 road closures and clearways

properties.otherAdvice:
Major roads are closed in the Sydney CBD for the Anzac Day Dawn Service in Martin Place and March on Elizabeth St.

  • *CLOSED* From 2am to 6pm: Angel Place and Ash St between George and Pitt Streets.
  • *CLOSED *From 6am to 4pm: major roads along and surrounding the march route between Bridge St and Goulburn St including sections of Castlereagh, Elizabeth, King, Market, Hunter, Bent, Park, Bathurst, Phillip and Liverpool Streets.

Cycleways on Pitt St, Liverpool St and Castlereagh St are closed until 4pm between Bridge St and King St.

Special event clearway parking restrictions are in effect until 4pm across the city including sections of Clarence St, Castlereagh St, Pitt St, Elizabeth St, Bridge St, Goulburn St, Liverpool St, Park St and various other major roads - check signs carefully.

Clearways are strict no-parking zones and apply even to local residents, businesses or Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies so check signs carefully on the day and the night before as clearways come into effect in the early morning.

arrangementElements.html:
Road closures affect both directions unless stated otherwise.

SYDNEY CBD

FROM 2AM TO 4PM

  • Pitt Street between Hunter Street and King Street
  • Castlereagh Street Between Hunter Street and King Street
  • Hosking Place from Castlereagh Street
  • De Mestre Place From George Street
  • George Street Between Hunter Street and King Street

FROM 2AM TO 6PM

  • Angel Place between George Street and Pitt Street
  • Ash Street From Angel Place

arrangementElements.title: Road Closures

arrangementElements.html:
Special event clearways are strict no parking zones even for local residents and RMS Mobility Scheme Parking Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your car is towed, call the Traffic Information Line on 132 701 to find its new location.

properties.headline: NRL - MOORE PARK Moore Park Road, Anzac Parade, Lang Road, Eastern Distributor approaching The Sydney Cricket Ground
properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.

arrangementAttachments.fileName: GS_2205_MOORE PARK EVENT DAY CLEARWAYS MAP_V004_22FEB22.pdf
arrangementAttachments.linkName: Moore Park game day clearway map

arrangementAttachments.fileName: 2021 Moore Park transport and walking map mar21  SHUTTLES EP23.pdf

properties.otherAdvice:
NRL: Dragons v Roosters Anzac Day match at the SCG. Kick-off from 4:05pm and full-time around 6pm.

*All car parks in the Moore Park precinct are now full. Consider parking in the CBD and catch public transport to the game.

Traffic will be heavier than usual on roads approaching and around Moore Park including the Eastern Distributor, Moore Park Rd, Cleveland St, Anzac Pde and Lang Rd.

Driver Ave will be partially closed outside the stadium from 12.45pm and will reopen once crowds have safely cleared the area after the game.

Special event clearways are in effect on roads in Moore Park and surrounding areas from 1pm until 8pm including sections of Lang Road, Fitzroy Street, Chalmers Street, Moore Park Road, Albion Street, Cleveland Street, Flinders Street and Foveaux Street.

Clearways are strict no-parking zones even for local residents and Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies.

arrangementElements.html:
Special event clearways are strict no-parking zones even for local residents and Mobility Scheme Parking Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your vehicle is towed, call 132 701 to find its new location.

SURRY HILLS / MOORE PARK FROM 1PM TO 8PM

  • Albion Street between Mary Street and Flinders Street (northern side)
  • Albion Street between Bourke Street and Flinders Street (southern side)
  • Cleveland Street between South Dowling Street and City Road (both sides)
  • Flinders Street between Albion Street and Moore Park Road (eastern side)
  • Fitzroy Street between South Dowling Street and Bourke Street (northern side)
  • Foveaux Street between Bourke Street and Crown Street (northern side)
  • Lang Road between Cook Road and Anzac Parade (both sides)
  • Moore Park Road* between Driver Avenue and Anzac Parade (southern side)
  • Moore Park Road between Flinders Street and Greens Road (northern side)

*24 hour clearways are in effect on the southern side of Moore Park Road from Lang Road to Driver Avenue to support the pop-up cycleway.
